intro: Licania filomenoi, commonly known as the Filomena licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
